title: Where will the film "Fahrenheit 11/9" rank for its first week in theaters?
preds: Having seem the film, it is very much "preaching to the choir".  Based on his last few films, it's unlikely to cross the $5-7 million threshhold required to crack the top 5 this weekend.

Fahrenheit is releasing on under 1800 screens. This means it would have to have a much higher per screen average than at least 4 other movies that will be on 2500+ screens the same weekend. It is rather unlikely given the good but not great reception in the friendly Toronto crowd during TIFF. There is just not enough buzz to warrant a high per screen average. It will also compete for progressive viewers with White boy rick and Assassination Nation while there are 3 movies that grossed over 20mln USD the previous week + 1 movie being released this week forecasted to open in that range. The holdovers will drop to min 10mln usd + while all tracking suggests Fahrenheit will open arund 4mln.

I think the USA generally shows signs of 'Moore Fatigue'.  There will be a cohort of the cinema going public who will show up for the film, but I think this may experience the lacklustre results of An Inconvenient Sequel.

19 from 12 0-0-0-14-86.  Was 0-35-35-20-10 but dropping heaps due to crowd, as tiny as the sample is to 0-15-30-30-25. [Ooops same as N-P, so going to shift 5 to #2, going 0-22-33-30-15 instead, but will probably just change to 0-20-30-30-20 if reviews are good].  Most put majority in last box, so seems a bit of bias. I don't like Moore much at all, but then again you'd be hard pressed to find an obese person I pay any attention to.  Interesting that @N-P has a good spread 0-15-30-30-25 a bit of a bell curve rather than low to high or hockey stick curve of the crowd. Edit: Sep21 only 44 from 21 on 0-0-0-1-3-96
Edit2: dang forgot about this q LOL I'm such a moron, err hang on Moore-on! Ha! So punny!  Dang missed it by 3 hours too. Damn it, if only I got to this q then! Everyone seems to have gone all in to easy bucket on Sept 21, 6 days ago, or 8 days after this Sept 13th bet. Freaking hell. Now more reason to dislike the obese goof that is Michael Moore.

Even people who agree with what he thinks he's trying to say are wearying of this lad.  This film won't exactly bomb, but it will sink pretty fast--those who think he's still clever will show up the first couple of weeks, but word is this one is pretty much a dog's breakfast, so it won't be widely recommended even by his fans.  It'll hit the top five first week, though.

Crazy Rich Asians is in the way, so would be surprising if it gets past #2. Would depend on how many theatres it opens in. Will they go for 1000 or 2000? Maybe even get to 3000?!  Quiet here on this q, would have thought some of the MAGA crowd would be all 100% in the last bracket on this one? A sign the GJO site is past its peak? Seems they don't like questions that are too longer, now this 21 day one seems to be too short for them? Goldilocks, it's adorable. Just lots more whinging ;-p
